CatDescriptText: Mr. Chalmers Sloan, 47 Michigan St, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "I think that it would be good.  However, it is hard to say whether or not it is the answer."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Chalmers Sloan, wearing hat, eyeglasses, moustache, striped shirt, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of block building with two windows with light colored curtains, second man on the left
